result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rand A Brinkman

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rand A Brinkman in court, in custody.  Attorney Kenneth Olstinski in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant appears without Defense Counsel. SPD filed a letter with the court stating that they are still unable to appoint counsel. Requests more time or for court to appoint an attorney. Defendant filed a motion to dismiss due to timing and lack of counsel. Court denies motion. Court orders matter adjourned for a Status Of Counsel.
Status conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.
OSPD Appointment Of Counsel Report, Received and Filed

Defendant Rand A Brinkman in court, in custody.  Attorney Kenneth Olstinski in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Matter in court for status of counsel.  Court orders case set for a State vs Lee hearing.
Hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Motion to Dismiss.  (Rand A. Brinkman - #2022000810, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Defendant Rand A Brinkman in court, in custody.  Attorney Kenneth Olstinski in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Counsel needs to be appointed.  Clerk to send notice to the PD's office to appoint a Public Defender.
Status conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Letter from defendant re:  withdrawal of counsel.  (Rand A. Brinkman - #2022000810, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).
Defendant's Motion to Dismiss, Request to Withdraw Preliminary Hearing Waiver.  (Rand A. Brinkman - #2022000810, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).
Defendant's Motion to Dismiss.  (Rand A. Brinkman - #2022000810, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Defendant Rand A Brinkman in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Rand Brinkman in custody. Kenneth Olstinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Matter scheduled for Jury Trial.  State is ready to proceed.  Counsel informed Court there has been a breakdown in communication.  Defense motion to withdraw as counsel is granted by the court. Defense counsel will notify Public Defender's Office to appoint new counsel for the defendant.  Case adjourned, Br. 15.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04E (Amended), parties are hereby advised: Effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen R. Brostrom, in Room 506 of the Safety Building.  Status conference scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; Defendant's Motion to Withdraw

Defendant Rand A Brinkman in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Rand A Brinkman in custody.  Kenneth Olstinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Final Pretrial held.  Court placed decision on state's other acts motion.  For reasons stated on the record, Court excludes first fact set, but will admit second fact set.  Defendant's motion to withdraw counsel heard.  For reasons stated on the record, Court denies defendant's motion.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial on 7/25/2022 at 9:00 am.
Received and Filed. State's AMENDED Proposed Jury Instructions
Received and Filed. State's Motion in Limine
Received and Filed. State's Proposed Jury Instructions
Received and Filed. Defendant's Requested Jury Instructions
Received and Filed. Defendant's Witness List

Court is in trial and will be unable to hear this case.  Parties emailed of new court date.  Case scheduled for Final Pretrial on 7-21-2022 at 9:00 pm.  Jury Trial remains calendared for 7-25-2022 at 9:00 am.

Defendant Rand A Brinkman in court, in custody.  Emily S Zimmel appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Kenneth Olstinski.  Court finds the state has complied with victim notification.  Attorney Opland Dobs unavailable for court due to being in trial.  At the request of counsel this matter is adjourned in Br 15.  MN  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; Letter to the Court
Court REDUCES cash bail from $20,000 to $12,000 cash. All other previous conditions and terms of bail are to remain.

Defendant Rand A Brinkman in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Rand A Brinkman in custody.  
Kenneth Olstinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for bail bond hearing. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Bail motion by Defense argued and granted in part by the Court.  Cash bail set at $12,000.00 All other previous terms and conditions of bail are to remain. Case remains calendared before Branch 15 for final pretrial on 6-7-2022 at 9:30am.

At the request of Defense counsel, matter is set for a bail bond review on April 22, 2022 at 8:30am before Branch 15. Counsel agreed upon new date and time via email. Defense to notify Defendant of new date.
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; Motion to Exclude Other Acts Evidence
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; Defendant's Motion to Review Bail
Received and Filed. Notice of Motion and State's Motion to Admit Other Acts
Received and Filed. State's Witness List
Scheduling order signed in court.

Defendant Rand A Brinkman in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Rand A Brinkman in custody. Rand A Brinkman appeared by video means with Attorney. 
Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense requests trial dates. Scheduling Order completed in court. Case remains calendared in Branch 15.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Rand A Brinkman in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Rand A Brinkman in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rand A Brinkman appeared by video means with Attorney.  Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 15, Judge J.D. Watts. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; no contact order.   If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with SMM; HRB

Defendant Rand A Brinkman in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Rand A Brinkman in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rand A Brinkman appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
